intro: Cohniella yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan cactus, is a species native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is a small, spiny cactus that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features a compact, globular stem with short, white spines and produces yellow flowers during the spring season. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
